Murrieta.Murrieta Hogbacks:
The Murrieta Hogbacks are Miocene basalt capped granitic hogbacks located approximately 4 miles northeast of Murrieta on the southern end of the Temescal Mountains of Riverside County, California.


== Geology ==
The Murrieta Hogbacks are underlain by Cretaceous granitic rocks of the Peninsular Ranges Batholith. On the north half of the hogbacks, by foliated biotite-hornblende tonalite and on the southern half by hornblende gabbro.
